title: Phil Kessel Breaks NHL Record for Consecutive Games Played
description: Kessel, a right winger for the Vegas Golden Knights, played in his 990th straight game. “I just try to play no matter what.”
dc:creator: Victor Mather
media:description: Phil Kessel of the Vegas Golden Knights set an N.H.L. record for consecutive games played, topping the mark of 889, which was set by Philadelphia’s Keith Yandle.
